intro: Cerastium guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, rounded leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
